author: Leandro-Albano
body:
# Steps to reproduce

I execute the powershell and it takes 6 min to start at least.
I don't know how to provide more info. Can anyone help me with that?

# Expected behavior

Powershell starts fast

# Actual behavior

It takes 6 min to start

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16967104/71978490-67796d80-3213-11ea-9b59-cf27890f4bc3.png)

# Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.2.3
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    6.2.3
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.18362
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: Leandro-Albano
comments.body: Solved with a good restart. Sorry guys.

title: PowerShell very slow to start
